page.title: 05INDUSTRY IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: THE INDUSTRY IN STOCKSBRIDGE IS COMPLETELY DOMINATED BY THE STEEL WORKS BELONGING TO THE BRITISH STEEL CORPORATION, WHICH STRETCHES FOR 2 KILOMETRES ALONG THE VALLEY FLOOR OF THE RIVER DON (OR LITTLE DON AS IT IS KNOWN LOCALLY). THE WORKS WERE STARTED BY SAMUEL FOX IN 1842 MAKING CRINOLINE AND UMBRELLA FRAMES. OVER THE YEARS IT HAS GROWN IN SIZE AND IN THE VARIETY OF STEEL PRODUCED. SINCE NATIONALISATION IN THE 1960'S THE W0RKS HAS SPECIALISED IN STAINLESS STEEL. TODAY IT IS ONE OF THE FEW B.S.C. FACTORIES TO MAKE A PROFIT BY CONCENTRATING ALL ITS PRODUCTION ON STAINLESS STEEL STRIPS AND WIRE. IT HAS NOW A WORKFORCE OF 3500 PEOPLE AND IN FACT JUST UNDER 50% OF THE CHILDREN IN STOCKSBRIDGE HAVE PARENTS WORKING THERE.
